rules: Rule1: Provided that a researcher publishes a paper, society controls a disease.
Rule2: Under the condition that a team identifies a virus, society controls a disease.
Rule3: Whenever a team identifies a host, society controls a disease.
Rule4: If a team monitors an outbreak, then either that team identifies a virus or that team identifies a host.
Rule5: An outbreak contains a region or a team monitors an outbreak.
Rule6: An agency imposes a quarantine or an agency imposes a travel ban.
Rule7: Provided that an agency imposes a travel ban, an outbreak does not contain a region.
Rule8: If an agency approves a vaccine, then a vaccine deploys to a population.
Rule9: If an agency approves a vaccine, then a vaccine does not deploy to a population.
Rule10: An agency approves a vaccine or, if an agency recommends a measure, then the condition that an agency imposes a quarantine implies that an outbreak does not contain a region.
Rule11: Provided that a virus infects a human, society controls a disease.
Rule12: If a lab sequences a genome, then data uploads to a database.
Rule13: Provided that data analyzes a genome, a virus does not mutate into a strain.
Rule14: If data uploads to a database, then data analyzes a genome.
Rule15: If an agency funds research, then the following holds: if it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, then a company does not profit from a vaccine.
Rule16: An agency funds research or an agency collaborates with a university.
Rule17: If a university shares findings, then the following holds: if it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, then a company does not profit from a vaccine.
Rule18: Provided that a researcher studies a virus, a researcher publishes a paper.
Rule19: If a committee delays an approval, then a trial halts a vaccine.
Rule20: A committee delays an approval or, if an agency collaborates with a university, then a university shares findings.

Rule21: Provided that the WHO declares an emergency, the following holds: if it is not the case that imposing a quarantine implies an outbreak does not contain a region, then an outbreak escalates into a pandemic.
Rule22: Under the condition that the WHO alerts a country, the WHO declares an emergency.
Rule23: The WHO alerts a country or the WHO alerts a region.
Rule24: If the WHO alerts a region, then the WHO declares an emergency.

Rule25: Provided that a journal publishes a study, the following holds: if it is not the case that (it is not the case that (it is not the case that sequencing a genome implies analyzing a genome) implies a researcher does not discover a variant) implies a test confirms a variant, then a health organization warns the public.
Rule26: Under the condition that a researcher studies a bat, a virus infects a human.
Rule27: Provided that a lab tests a drug, a drug cures a virus.

Rule28: If a lab uses a model, then the following holds: if it is not the case that (it is not the case that a researcher studies a virus or a researcher studies a bat) implies a researcher develops a drug, then a lab tests a drug.

Rule29: Provided that a lab uses a simulation, the following holds: if it is not the case that (it is not the case that a researcher studies a virus or a researcher studies a bat) implies a researcher develops a drug, then a lab tests a drug.
Rule30: If it is not the case that sequencing a genome implies analyzing a genome, then a researcher discovers a variant.
Rule31: Under the condition that it is not the case that licensing a technology implies patenting a vaccine, a company profits from a vaccine.
Rule32: Under the condition that it is not the case that a lab uses a model or a lab uses a simulation, a model validates a drug.
Rule33: Provided that it is not the case that a lab uses a model or a lab uses a simulation, a model does not validate a drug.
Rule34: If it is not the case that (it is not the case that a researcher studies a virus or a researcher studies a bat) implies a researcher develops a drug, then a drug does not cure a virus.
Rule35: Under the condition that society does not control a disease, a virus mutates into a strain.
Rule36: Provided that society does not control a disease, a lab sequences a genome.
Rule37: Provided that society does not control a disease, a company licenses a technology.
facts: Fact1: An agency recommends a measure.
Fact2: A journal publishes a study.
Fact3: A company does not patent a vaccine.
Fact4: A trial does not halt a vaccine.
Fact5: An outbreak does not escalate into a pandemic.
Fact6: A test does not confirm a variant.
Fact7: A health organization does not warn the public.
Fact8: A researcher does not develop a drug.
